result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Ronald Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds and earnings.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two.  Cedit for 150 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment of at least 20 hours per week.

Continue following recommended mental healty treatment and any medicine regimen.
Mental health evaluation. Comply with recommended treatment.
No contact with Marine Credit Union or any Walgreens location.

AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety from all illgal drugs and alcohol.
Turn over any prescriptions to agent before filling them.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutivee to count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Ronald Meyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Memorandum submitted by defense counsel received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Addendum to PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Jason Ronald Meyer in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jason Ronald Meyer in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNTS 1 & 2-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. Attorney Lin requested to be present at the PSI interview. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Jason Ronald Meyer not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waived the defendant's appearance for the purpose of today's proceedings. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 20.  All parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 case will be reassigned to Branch 25, Judge Stephanie Rothstein, in Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Jason Ronald Meyer not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requsted another scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Jason Ronald Meyer not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling conference; is awaiting receipt of defendant's medical and mental health records.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Ronald Meyer in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jason Ronald Meyer in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel requested a scheduling date.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Ronald Meyer in court with attorney Michael Jude for Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jason Ronald Meyer in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Arraignment scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MARINE CREDIT UNION, WALGREENS, 2727 W NORTH AVE., DANIEL E., AND TONJAE S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jason Ronald Meyer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jason Ronald Meyer in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
